newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Electrolux eyes 2 Swedish plants in cuts.
newsitem.headline: Electrolux eyes 2 Swedish plants in cuts.

text.p: Swedish appliance maker, Electrolux, said on Friday it was looking at closing a factory that make large kitchen equipment at Alingsas in Sweden as well as possibly selling an Electrolux-Eurocleans factory at Atvidaberg.
This was part of Electrolux's previously announced plan to close about 25 factoris and cut 12,000 jobs worldwide.
Other Swedish factories would not be included in the company's restructuring, Electrolux said.
"Other forms of rationalisation will be carried out," an Electrolux spokesman said.
Winding up the factory at Alingsas is only one alternative and no firm decision has yet been made. The factory has 190 employees.
Other possibilities were also being explored for the factory at Atvidaberg that has about 30 staff.
The spokesman said the decisions on which Electrolux plants would be closed would not be released at any one time but the company's divisions would be making their statements about closures.
